entries.description: Bengali placeholder emphasising retroflex flaps, palatal fricatives, and nasal vowels.
Filipino placeholder addressing velar nasals, Spanish ñ loans, and affricate onsets.
Finnish placeholder covering vowel length contrasts, front rounded vowels, and velar nasals.
Gujarati placeholder emphasising retroflex laterals, palatal nasals, and vocalic r vowels.
Indonesian placeholder capturing prenasalised onsets and clear loan consonants.
Kannada placeholder covering retroflex laterals, palatal nasals, and diphthongs used in literary Kannada.
Malay placeholder aligned with peninsular pronunciation, balancing Arabic loans and Malay vowels.
Marathi placeholder focusing on syllabic /r̩/, retroflex laterals, and complex consonant conjuncts.
Nepali placeholder emphasising aspirated affricates, velar nasals, and consonant clusters with /r/.
Seeded Persian profile that foregrounds ezafe liaisons and the soft postalveolar fricatives common in Tehrani speech.
Sinhala placeholder emphasising prenasalised stops, palatal nasals, and loan fricatives.
Castilian defaults matching eSpeak es
Swahili placeholder emphasising prenasalised consonants and open vowels for East African dialects.
Yoruba placeholder covering three-level tone diacritics and labio-velar stops.
Pronunciation cues transcribed from JAWS, Window-Eyes, and Loquence studio dictionaries
Italian vowel core tied to eSpeak it voice
Brazilian Portuguese nasal set mapped from eSpeak pt-br
Core Devanagari characters tuned against eSpeak hi phonemes
Receives vowels tuned for eSpeak en-gb
Burmese placeholder highlighting creaky vs modal tone, aspiration markers, and vowel colouring.
Czech placeholder emphasising the ř trill, velar fricative ch, and palatal nasals.
Danish placeholder highlighting stød, uvular r, and vowel reductions.
Captures Hausa ejective stops and high/low tone contrasts for the Latin orthography.
Modern Israeli Hebrew placeholder accentuating uvular frication and ejective-like tsadi bursts.
Norwegian placeholder capturing palatal kj, retroflex skj, and pitch accent pairs.
Polish placeholder emphasising alveolo-palatal vs retroflex sibilants and dark ł vowels.
Swedish placeholder emphasising sj/tj fricatives and tonal accent pairs.
Vietnamese placeholder highlighting tone contours, implosives, and short vowels.
Zulu placeholder mixing click consonants with lateral fricatives to prep the phoneme editor.
Latin American Spanish vowels and consonants following eSpeak es-la
Placeholder emphasising Amharic ejectives and the seven-syllable abugida patterns.
Captures Cairene consonant shifts (gīm→/g/, qāf→/ʔ/) so phoneme EQ can mimic everyday Egyptian Arabic.
Core French characters tuned against eSpeak fr defaults
Greek placeholder emphasising dental fricatives, velar fricatives, and consonant clusters.
Khmer placeholder capturing palatal nasals, aspirated affricates, and complex vowel nuclei.
Korean placeholder balancing tense consonants, aspiration, and vowel harmony cues.
Russian placeholder tuned for palatalised consonants, retroflex fricatives, and reduced vowels.
Tamil placeholder anchoring retroflex approximants and geminate stops for Sangam-style articulation.
Telugu placeholder centred on aspirated retroflexes, velar nasals, and diphthong glides.
Turkish placeholder emphasising vowel harmony, soft g, and postalveolar fricatives.
Ukrainian placeholder focusing on palatalised consonants, /ɦ/ vs /g/, and melodic intonation.
Urdu placeholder capturing retroflex flaps and aspirated stops used in ghazal recitation and newscasts.
Key German letters referencing eSpeak de voice
Foundational Latin alphabet mapping derived from eSpeak en-us
Seeded MSA profile capturing emphatic coronals and the sun/moon assimilation patterns.
Dutch placeholder focusing on diphthongs IJ/UI and the sch/gt fricative cluster.
Lao placeholder emphasising silent-h tone class markers, diphthongs, and vowel carriers.
Malayalam placeholder tuned for retroflex approximants, nasal clusters, and geminated stops.
Punjabi placeholder aligning retroflex flaps, nasalisation, and tonal contrasts in Gurmukhi.
Cantonese placeholder covering high level, low falling, and nasal-only syllables.
Mandarin placeholder emphasising neutral tones, retroflex affricates, and aspect particles.
Kana coverage with pitch-accent guidance for NVDA phoneme hints
Thai placeholder featuring high-class consonants, long vowels, and diphthongs.
